message.content:
cs.IR, cs.DL, cs.HC, cs.CL, cs.CY 

This paper discusses the use of Memento, a web archiving tool, to avoid spoilers in fan wikis of episodic fiction. The paper focuses on analyzing data collected from fan wikis and the Internet Archive, and proposes an algorithm for calculating the probability of encountering a spoiler in a given wiki article. This work involves information retrieval (cs.IR) and digital libraries (cs.DL) as it deals with web archiving and accessing archived web pages. It also involves human-computer interaction (cs.HC) and natural language processing (cs.CL) as it discusses the use of fan wikis and the language used in these wikis. Finally, it involves cybernetics (cs.CY) as it deals with the interaction between humans and technology in the context of avoiding spoilers.
